solution_line_template: Her cash back app gave her {cashback_percent_num}% back on ${initial_cost} so that's {cashback_percent_decimal}*{initial_cost} = $<<{cashback_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{initial_cost}={cashback_amount}>>{cashback_amount} cash back

She received ${cashback_amount} from the cashback app and has a ${mail_in_rebate} mail-in rebate for a total of {cashback_amount_int}+{mail_in_rebate_int} = $<<{cashback_amount_int}+{mail_in_rebate_int}={total_discounts}>>{total_discounts} discounts

She spent ${initial_cost} for the medicine and has ${total_discounts} worth of discounts so the medicine will cost {initial_cost_int}-{total_discounts_int} = $<<{initial_cost_int}-{total_discounts_int}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}
